trans-unit.source: Emulates the behavior of a Visual Basic 6.0 fixed-length string.
In Visual Basic 6.0, a `String` could be declared with a fixed length.
In [!INCLUDE[vbprvb](~/includes/vbprvb-md.md)], fixed-length strings are no longer supported and a new <xref:System.String> is allocated every time the length of the <xref:System.String> is changed.
The `FixedLengthString` class can be used to emulate the behavior of a Visual Basic 6.0 string, which enables you to declare a string with a fixed length.

A `FixedLengthString` cannot be converted to a <xref:System.String>; you must either reference the <xref:Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6.FixedLengthString.Value%2A> property or call the <xref:Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6.FixedLengthString.ToString%2A> method to convert the type.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6.FixedLengthString"></xref> class, specifying the length.
In Visual Basic 6.0, you can specify the length of a string in its declaration.
In [!INCLUDE[vbprvb](~/includes/vbprvb-md.md)], you cannot declare a string to have a fixed length unless you use the <xref:Microsoft.VisualBasic.VBFixedStringAttribute> attribute in the declaration.
Use this class to declare a fixed-length string without using the attribute.
An `Integer` that specifies the length of the string.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6.FixedLengthString"></xref> class, specifying the length and the initial value.
In Visual Basic 6.0, you can specify the length of a string in its declaration.
In [!INCLUDE[vbprvb](~/includes/vbprvb-md.md)], you cannot declare a string to have a fixed length unless you use the <xref:Microsoft.VisualBasic.VBFixedStringAttribute> attribute in the declaration.
Use this class to declare a fixed length string without using the attribute.
An `Integer` that specifies the length of the string.
A <xref href="System.String"></xref> that specifies the initial contents.
Stores the length of a <xref href="Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6.FixedLengthString"></xref>.
Stores the value of a <xref href="Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6.FixedLengthString"></xref>.
Converts a <xref href="Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6.FixedLengthString"></xref> to a <xref href="System.String"></xref>.
The <xref:Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6.FixedLengthString> class can be used to emulate the behavior of a Visual Basic 6.0 string, which enables you to declare a string with a fixed length.

A <xref:Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6.FixedLengthString> cannot be converted to a <xref:System.String>; you must either reference the <xref:Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6.FixedLengthString.Value%2A> property or call the <xref:Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6.FixedLengthString.ToString%2A> method to convert the type.
A <xref href="System.String"></xref> that contains the value of the <xref href="Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6.FixedLengthString"></xref>.
Gets or sets the contents of a <xref href="Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6.FixedLengthString"></xref>.
The <xref:Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6.FixedLengthString> class can be used to emulate the behavior of a Visual Basic 6.0 string, which enables you to declare a string with a fixed length.

A <xref:Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6.FixedLengthString> cannot be converted to a <xref:System.String>; you must either reference the <xref:Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6.FixedLengthString.Value%2A> property or call the <xref:Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6.FixedLengthString.ToString%2A> method to convert the type.
A <xref href="System.String"></xref> that contains the value.
